title: Normalize remaining world-map test files away from barrel and directory imports
description: Apply explicit file `.ts` specifiers across the remaining world-map `*.test.ts` targets that still import from directories/barrels (`../application`, `../infra`, `../../heroes/infra`, `../../heroes/ports`) so direct `node --test` execution does not depend on loader-specific resolution behavior.
acceptance_criteria: At least one additional world-map API or application test target outside hostile and march-dispatch runs via `node --test --test-isolation=none` with no `ERR_UNSUPPORTED_DIR_IMPORT`.
Touched imports in targeted files use explicit local file paths with `.ts` extensions.
No assertions or gameplay logic are changed in those test files.

title: Add CI validation for first-slice hostile runtime token contract drift
description: Add a validator that cross-checks canonical hostile keys, required tokens, alias mappings, and deferred exclusions in `first-slice-hostile-runtime-token-contract.json` against `first-slice-content-key-manifest.json` and `event-feed-messages.json` so dispatch/arrive/resolve/post-battle payload contracts stay locked.
acceptance_criteria: Validation fails if any hostile canonical key in the contract is missing from manifest loop required keys or event feed seed rows
Validation fails if any declared compatibility alias key is selected as a direct default canonical key
Validation fails if any deferred hero/gather/ambush key appears in hostile contract required runtime keys
Failure output includes key-level mismatch details for fast correction
